pros: All Telehealth, good support system
cons: Clumsy EMR, no additional time to do all the extras required outside of appointment time.

job_title: Licensed Mental Health Counselor in Longwood, FL
pros: The flexibility and work from home benefits are undeniable. Supervising management is excellent, and good boundaries are set with clients to minimize no shows if the clinician is working to enforce them. Referrals are given.
cons: Pay is poor for licensed clinicians and incentive pay means PTO is terrible. Insurance benefits are awful. EMR system is not clinician friendly.

pros: Work from home and meet wonderful clients
cons: Horrible work environment. No support from Management. Lack of training and an all-around disorganized mess of a company. This company cares more about getting paid than what they offer employees or their clients.

pros: None that come to mind
cons: This company really only thinks of the bottom line and not their employees.

job_title: Client Support Specialist in Longwood, FL
pros: Mostly Telehealth appointments. CEO seems to care about employees. Direct supervisors not so much
cons: No room for advancement in the psychiatric clinic

pros: Telehealth and great work/life balance. Fabulous middle management
cons:

pros:
Remote
Benefits 
Salary
Good work life balance 
Flex hours
cons:
High turnover of management
Poor communication 
Out for money
Poor culture

pros: Flexibility, flexibilty, flexibility and lastly, flexibility.
cons: Work is unstable, leadership is poor, every clinician is looking for alternative employment, you don't get paid in a timely fashion or not at all due to disorganization. You are always chasing the client and dealing with no shows/cancellations. Policies change to benefit management. PTO does not afford the opportunity for real time off, only $8.05 an hour. You will not be compensated for every document impower bills for or mileage, staff meetings, trainings and all of the other things you do daily. This could be a good company with a positive change in leadership and compensation.

review_title: DO NOT WORK HERE PLEASE READ
pros: For me, it was working from home as a telehealth therapist however, keep in mind that they advertise telehealth positions and will promise you when they hire you that you will be strictly telehealth but eventually management will push you to be out in the community seeing clients  ON TOP of your telehealth clients. So it's not worth it.
cons: Where do I start? THIS IS THE WORST COMPANY I HAVE EVER WORKED FOR! I was laid off while pregnant. Management/HR/my supervisors all knew I was pregnant and a high risk pregnancy at that - I told them all early on and explained that I would not be able to see clients in the community ON TOP of my telehealth clients. No one "seemed" to have an issue with this....that is so I thought and didn't realize until I was laid off. It is completely inhumane as they acted like I made the high risk pregnancy up and when I confronted them about it they told me "I never provided any kind proof." Which of course they never asked for and by law I am not obligated to do so. The whole thing has made me sick to my stomach because this company and the CEO don't give a damn about their employees they just want to continue pocketing their hefty paychecks off of medicaid individuals and therapists who barely make minimum wage. You will get paid more if you work at Disney than if you work for this company. Everything they tell you during the interview is a lie so don't believe it or better yet don't bother applying if you want to save yourself a massive headache.

pros: Provides great experience in Community Mental Health and providing services via Telehealth, wonderful CEO
cons: Incredibly high management turnover rate which makes staying on the same page very difficult, therapists often feel unsupported by direct supervisors

pros: Provide counseling program or services to children or adults.
cons: None - staff is always willing to go the extra mile for families/clients
